intro: Brackenridgea rubescens, commonly known as the red-flowered brackenridgea, is a striking member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southern United States, particularly Texas, where it thrives in dry, rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in late spring, adding vibrant color to the landscape. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Brackenridgea rubescens is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
